scripts.//0: # Setting ENABLE_WASM_EXTENSIONS=true causes a second module to be built as well,
scripts.//1: # that utilizes WebAssembly extensions, instead of it just being a 'fake' - a copy
scripts.//3: # Unfortunately, we have to set `$RUSTFLAGS` here, instead of in `.cargo/config.toml`
scripts.//4: # (for example), because it's not yet possible to specify them per-profile:
scripts.//6: # Enabling `build-std` would also be great, but it's not stable yet.
scripts.prebuild: npm run build:wasm-vanilla && npm run build:wasm-extensions
scripts.build:wasm-vanilla: cross-env OUT_NAME=ruffle_web CARGO_PROFILE=web-vanilla-wasm RUSTFLAGS="$RUSTFLAGS --cfg=web_sys_unstable_apis -Aunknown_lints" npm run build:wasm
scripts.//7: # Dispatches to either building the real, or copying the fake (stand-in),
scripts.build:wasm-extensions: node -e "process.exit(process.env.ENABLE_WASM_EXTENSIONS == 'true' ? 0 : 1)" && npm run build:wasm-extensions-real || npm run build:wasm-extensions-fake
scripts.build:wasm-extensions-real: echo "Building module with WebAssembly extensions" && cross-env OUT_NAME=ruffle_web-wasm_extensions CARGO_PROFILE=web-wasm-extensions RUSTFLAGS="$RUSTFLAGS --cfg=web_sys_unstable_apis -Aunknown_lints -C target-feature=+bulk-memory,+simd128,+nontrapping-fptoint,+sign-ext,+reference-types" WASM_BINDGEN_FLAGS="--reference-types" WASM_OPT_FLAGS="--enable-reference-types" npm run build:wasm
scripts.build:wasm-extensions-fake: echo "Copying the vanilla module as stand-in" && shx cp dist/ruffle_web_bg.wasm dist/ruffle_web-wasm_extensions_bg.wasm && shx cp dist/ruffle_web_bg.wasm.d.ts dist/ruffle_web-wasm_extensions_bg.wasm.d.ts && shx cp dist/ruffle_web.js dist/ruffle_web-wasm_extensions.js && shx cp dist/ruffle_web.d.ts dist/ruffle_web-wasm_extensions.d.ts
scripts.//9: # This just chains together the three commands after it.
scripts.build:wasm: npm run build:cargo && npm run build:wasm-bindgen && npm run build:wasm-opt
scripts.build:wasm-opt-failed: echo 'NOTE: Since wasm-opt could not be found (or it failed), the resulting module might not perform that well, but it should still work.' && echo ; [ "$CI" != true ] # > nul
